projects.title: Code Your Cloud
projects.text: This project arose from a person frustration, namely the lack of online code editors which use Google Drive. In developing this project, I learned how to use Node.js, MongoDB, MySQL, and Polymer. It currently has about 15,000 monthly users

projects.title: ARISense
projects.text: ARISense is a device developed by Aerodyne Research (where I interned). It is a low-cost pollution-monitoring device. I created the database which stores the tens of thousands of data points each node creates, along with the map and API which allow users to interact with the data

projects.title: HOW2.I2P
projects.text: i2p is an anonymous internet protocol similar to Tor. HOW2.I2P is an attempt to provide an introduction to this technology

projects.title: Iota
projects.text: A documentation browser I created using Node-Webkit (now NW.js)

projects.title: Scripts
projects.text: As a member of the MIT/Lincoln-Laboratory Cyberpatriot Cybersecurity team, specializing in Linux, I created these scripts to automate many common security proceedures

projects.title: Imgurize
projects.text: Imgurize is a fun project which renders images from the image-posting site imgur in ASCII art within a terminal

projects.title: RMDR
projects.text: A fun command-line utility which I made to easily set reminders

projects.title: Prompted
projects.text: Another silly project, prompted simulates a basic linux shell in pure javascript

projects.title: CodeMirror Themes
projects.text: A tool I made to create CodeMirror syntax highlighting themese

projects.title: Nodebot
projects.text: A bot I made for ssh-chat
